intro: Omalotheca roeseri, commonly known as the Mexican buttercup, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Mexico, characterized by its showy yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and it is noted for its ornamental value in horticulture. However, it is considered invasive in some regions, posing a threat to native plant communities.
